result.execSummary:
The defendant William Ray Hibbler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.

DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 10:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William Ray Hibbler in court, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Faun Michelle Moses in court for William Ray Hibbler. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Defendant waives right to pre sentence investigation.  Court orders on Count 1 - 18 months Wisconsin State Prison and 2 years Extended Supervision, imposed and stayed, 3 years probation, any treatment deemed necessary, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, DOC collect costs, 78 days sentence credit. Defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs. This case is concurrent with 21CF962.
